text: How’s this for a scheduling bombshell? Peacock has officially set a premiere date for its new Love Island spinoff. Love Island: Beyond the Villa, which “follows everyone’s favorite Season 6 Islanders around Los Angeles as they navigate new careers, evolving friendships, newfound fame and complex relationships,” will premiere Sunday, July 13. The spinoff’s core cast includes Leah Kateb and Miguel Harichi, JaNa Craig and Kenny Rodriguez, Kaylor Martin and Aaron Evans, Connor Newsum, Kendall Washington, and Olivia “Liv” Walker. New episodes will stream every Thursday at 6 pm PT/9 pm ET beginning July 17. Watch a trailer: In other recent scheduling news… * Magic City: An American Fantasy, a five-part docuseries that brings viewers inside the famed Atlanta club and features an oral history from the A-listers who made it legendary, will premiere Friday, Aug. 15 on Starz. Watch a trailer: * TBS’ Friday Night Vibes, hosted by fashion designer Nina Parker and comedian Kevin “KevOnStage” Fredericks, will shift from a monthly to a weekly release schedule beginning Friday, June 27 at 8 pm. Meanwhile, Dinner and a Movie (hosted by real-life couple Jason Biggs and Jenny Mollen) returns with a two-night premiere on Saturday, June 28 and Sunday, June 29 at 8 pm. * Claw Hunters, an hour-long weekly series about lobster fishing in the North Atlantic, will premiere Sunday, June 15 on The Weather Channel.
html:
How’s this for a scheduling bombshell? Peacock has officially set a premiere date for its new Love Island spinoff.

Love Island: Beyond the Villa, which “follows everyone’s favorite Season 6 Islanders around Los Angeles as they navigate new careers, evolving friendships, newfound fame and complex relationships,” will premiere Sunday, July 13.

The spinoff’s core cast includes Leah Kateb and Miguel Harichi, JaNa Craig and Kenny Rodriguez, Kaylor Martin and Aaron Evans, Connor Newsum, Kendall Washington, and Olivia “Liv” Walker.

New episodes will stream every Thursday at 6 pm PT/9 pm ET beginning July 17. Watch a trailer:

In other recent scheduling news…

* Magic City: An American Fantasy, a five-part docuseries that brings viewers inside the famed Atlanta club and features an oral history from the A-listers who made it legendary, will premiere Friday, Aug. 15 on Starz. Watch a trailer:

* TBS’ Friday Night Vibes, hosted by fashion designer Nina Parker and comedian Kevin “KevOnStage” Fredericks, will shift from a monthly to a weekly release schedule beginning Friday, June 27 at 8 pm. Meanwhile, Dinner and a Movie (hosted by real-life couple Jason Biggs and Jenny Mollen) returns with a two-night premiere on Saturday, June 28 and Sunday, June 29 at 8 pm.

* Claw Hunters, an hour-long weekly series about lobster fishing in the North Atlantic, will premiere Sunday, June 15 on The Weather Channel.
